data.title: Thryv: Strategic SaaS Transition Clouds Near-Term Growth Visibility, Supporting a Neutral Hold Rating
data.description:
William Blair analyst Arjun Bhatia has reiterated their neutral stance on THRY stock, giving a Hold rating on February 20.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Arjun Bhatia has given his Hold rating due to a combination of factors tied to Thryv’s strategic transition and its impact on growth visibility. The company is shifting to its new Market, Sell, Grow platform and dialing back its older multiproduct and legacy marketing-services motions, which has already led to a sizable revenue guidance shortfall and implies that 2026 will be a reset year with meaningfully slower SaaS growth than in 2025.

As Thryv reduces its dependence on migrating legacy clients and instead leans more on still-developing organic customer acquisition and expansion, execution risk increases and the near-term growth trajectory becomes harder to forecast. Although the shares trade at what appear to be inexpensive multiples on 2026 SaaS revenue and EBITDA (especially if one assumes little value for the legacy operations), Bhatia sees the stock remaining out of favor until investors gain better clarity on the company’s sustainable growth rate, supporting a neutral, or Hold, stance rather than a more decisive buy or sell call.

In another report released on February 20, RBC Capital also maintained a Hold rating on the stock with a $7.00 price target.
data.author: TipRanks Auto-Generated Intelligence Newsdesk

data.title: Buy Rating on NCR Voyix: Strong Q4 Execution and Enterprise Wins Offset Near-Term Headwinds, Underscoring Compelling Valuation
data.description:
Needham analyst Mayank Tandon maintained a Buy rating on NCR Voyix today and set a price target of $12.00.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Mayank Tandon has given his Buy rating due to a combination of factors, including NCR Voyix’s stronger‑than‑expected fourth‑quarter performance and continued momentum in landing large enterprise customers. The company’s recent wins with major brands such as Chipotle for its Aloha platform and 7‑Eleven Philippines on the retail side highlight growing adoption of its upgraded solutions and support confidence in its long‑term growth prospects.

At the same time, Tandon views the softer initial FY26 EBITDA and EPS outlook as largely tied to temporary headwinds from the ODM hardware shift and restructuring expenses rather than a deterioration in the core business. Given that the shares trade at a relatively low multiple of roughly 4.5x EV/EBITDA on his FY27 forecast, he sees the current valuation as compelling versus the company’s earnings potential, justifying a Buy rating even as he trims the price target to $12.
data.author: TipRanks Auto-Generated Intelligence Newsdesk

data.title: TWFG, Inc. Class A: Accelerating Organic Growth, Margin Upside, and Cash-Flow-Fueled Capital Returns Support Buy Rating
data.description:
William Blair analyst Adam Klauber has maintained their bullish stance on TWFG stock, giving a Buy rating on February 23.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Adam Klauber has given his Buy rating due to a combination of factors, including TWFG, Inc. Class A’s stronger-than-expected revenue and adjusted EBITDA, which were driven by better contingent commissions, M&A contributions, and lower commission costs from a recent Florida program acquisition. He also notes that organic growth remains solid at around the low-teens, with new business expanding at its fastest rate in several years and retention holding in the low-90% range, despite some rate softening, particularly in auto.

Looking ahead, Klauber points to management’s guidance for double-digit organic expansion and high-teens total revenue growth, with EBITDA expectations modestly above market forecasts thanks to favorable mix toward higher-margin branches and MGA operations. He highlights the company’s robust free cash flow and healthy balance sheet as key enablers of ongoing acquisitions and planned share repurchases, and he believes the current valuation around 13x 2027 EV/EBITDA is attractive given the accelerating growth profile and potential for 15% to 20% long-term compounding in earnings and cash flow.

Klauber covers the Financial sector, focusing on stocks such as Progressive, Allstate, and Ehealth. According to TipRanks, Klauber has an average return of -4.7% and a 35.68% success rate on recommended stocks.

In another report released on February 23, Piper Sandler also maintained a Buy rating on the stock with a $22.00 price target.

data.title: Bentley Systems: Durable Double-Digit Growth and Underappreciated Cash Flow Support Buy Rating
data.description:
William Blair analyst Dylan Becker has reiterated their bullish stance on BSY stock, giving a Buy rating on February 24.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Dylan Becker has given his Buy rating due to a combination of factors tied to Bentley Systems’ recent performance and outlook. The company delivered robust fourth‑quarter results, with subscription revenue and ARR growing at low‑teens rates on a constant‑currency basis, underpinned by record infrastructure backlogs and rising adoption of its software to address capacity constraints.

Looking ahead, management’s initial 2026 guidance calls for similar low‑teens growth across total revenue, subscriptions, and ARR, alongside further operating margin expansion, reinforcing a durable Rule‑of‑40‑plus profile. Despite broader concerns about AI‑driven disruption in software, Becker views Bentley’s differentiated design platform, healthy infrastructure demand, and projected mid‑teens cash flow growth as not fully reflected in the current valuation at roughly 21x his 2026 cash flow estimate, justifying a Buy recommendation.

In another report released on February 24, Rosenblatt Securities also maintained a Buy rating on the stock with a $50.00 price target.
data.author: TipRanks Auto-Generated Intelligence Newsdesk

data.title: Rhythm Pharmaceuticals: Imcivree Momentum and Bivamelanotide Pipeline Catalysts Underpin Buy Rating and $130 Target
data.description:
TD Cowen analyst Phil Nadeau maintained a Buy rating on Rhythm Pharmaceuticals today and set a price target of $130.00.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Phil Nadeau has given his Buy rating due to a combination of factors, including solid commercial performance of Imcivree and clear upcoming growth catalysts. Imcivree’s fourth-quarter revenue rose both sequentially and year over year, supported by an expanding treated patient base, and the firm expects hypothalamic obesity, once approved, to become a key growth engine through 2026.

Phil Nadeau’s rating is based on the view that the pipeline further strengthens Rhythm’s outlook, particularly the oral candidate bivamelanotide, which has shown encouraging and durable BMI reductions in Phase II extension data. With pivotal trials for biva planned, two important Imcivree datasets due in March, and a near-term PDUFA decision that should broaden the label, he believes the company’s fundamentals support a $130 price target and justify a Buy recommendation.

According to TipRanks, Nadeau is a 4-star analyst with an average return of 7.5% and a 48.13% success rate. Nadeau covers the Healthcare sector, focusing on stocks such as Rhythm Pharmaceuticals, Vir Biotechnology, and BioMarin Pharmaceutical.

In another report released on February 18, RBC Capital also initiated coverage with a Buy rating on the stock with a $145.00 price target.
